metadata.title: USN-6583-1 -- MySQL vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Multiple security issues were discovered in MySQL and this update includes new upstream MySQL versions to fix these issues.  MySQL has been updated to 5.7.44 in Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.  In addition to security fixes, the updated packages contain bug fixes, new features, and possibly incompatible changes.  Please see the following for more information:  https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-44.html https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2023.html  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6583-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  mysql-client - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 libmysqlclient-dev - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 mysql-server - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 mysql-testsuite - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 libmysqld-dev - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.44-0ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
